page.title: 04HOMESTEADS AND FARMSTEADS
page.content: There are the remains of 4 or more homesteads or farmsteads: Great Hill Farm, Pimms and Higher and Lower Pasture Barn Farms. These were abandoned sometime when the reservoirs were built for fear of pollution. Still inhabited are Higher Pasture House, built in 1669, which was modernised in 1984 by the North West Water Authority. Lower Pasture House is also still inhabited, whilst Piccadilly is currently being restored and renovated. First mentioned in a deed of 1650 as the site of a water trough in the grounds of Hollinshead Hall (now derelict), the original sandstone trough was unearthed in 1985 during excavation work, still intact. In Thorny Bank Plantation is a drinking well, visited for opthalmic cures in the 19th century and restored by Liverpool Corporation in 1905.
